1498428438.excerpt: Emergence is the story of natural laws and processes, their inherent beauty, and their action to yield the universe, us and the world we live in. 3887015265.given_title: How to Steal a Masterpiece: Advice from the World’s Greatest Art Thief
3887015265.resolved_title: How to Steal a Masterpiece: Advice from the World’s Greatest Art Thief
3887015265.excerpt: First, says the art thief, forget about the movies. Skylight entries, smoke bombs, and shootouts may be cinematic, but unless you want to go to jail, these are terrible tactics for stealing art. Violence and destruction in a museum only minimize your odds of success.

 Our brains assemble Gustav Klimt’s paintings piece by piece, symbol by

Oskar Kokoschka painted emotional states more than people, Eric Kandel

2186550114.given_title: On the Strange, Artistic World of Marfa, Texas
2186550114.resolved_title: On the Strange, Artistic World of Marfa, Texas
2186550114.excerpt: I used to think Marfa was a kind of practical joke that West Texans were playing on cultural elites. It’s remote even for Texas. The nearest airports are in El Paso and Carlsbad, New Mexico, each 200 miles away. The landscape is okay if you like scrubby hills and plains of yellow grass.

3540445447.given_title: One comment on “The beauty and danger in Victorian Glass Fire Grenades”
3540445447.resolved_title: One comment on “The beauty and danger in Victorian Glass Fire Grenades”
3540445447.excerpt: When they were first introduced in the nineteenth century, Glass Fire Grenades were produced as decorative glass bottles with a bulbous bottom, long neck and usually patterned with the company name on them. So they are actually very pretty – for something designed to put out a fire.

2069915747.resolved_title: The History of the Color Blue: From Ancient Egypt to the Latest Scientific Discoveries
2069915747.excerpt: The color blue is associated with two of Earth’s greatest natural features: the sky and the ocean. But that wasn’t always the case. Some scientists believe that the earliest humans were actually colorblind and could only recognize black, white, red, and only later yellow and green.

2631291349.excerpt: Graffiti artists learn early not to get too attached. Ephemera is as central to their medium as spray paint. Some works last months, others don’t make it through the night. Even the most famous pieces are not guaranteed to last.

3805713618.resolved_title: The Art of the Shadow: How Painters Have Gotten It Wrong for Centuries
3805713618.excerpt: Shadows do not continue from the floor up the wall on the right. Piero della Francesca, Polittico di Sant’Antonio (detail), 1460–1470. Perugia, Galleria Nazionale dell’Umbria. Image credit: © Galleria Nazionale dell’Umbria.

2.caption: This article is adapted from Roberto Casati and Patrick Cavanagh’s book “The Visual World of Shadows“

3.caption: The Reutersvärd-Penrose triangle is quickly seen as being an impossible solid body. Image credit: Roberto Casati.

4.caption: Fig. 2 / A CAD-generated model of Masaccio’s “Tribute.” The shadows climb the bodies of the characters. Image credit: Meeko Kuwahara.

5.caption: Carpet shadows pass under objects as if the objects were not present.

6.caption: It is unlikely that a shadow ends abruptly precisely where there is a change in surface direction.

7.caption: Fig. 6 / Shadows bend around corners if the object is in the appropriate location relative to the light source and surface. However, after bending, shadows are largely deformed and generally elongated

8.caption: Fig. 10 / The man’s shadow only begins on the wall, without passing along the ground to get there. Biagio d’Antonio

9.caption: Fig. 12 / Detail from Konrad Witz’s “The Deliverance of Saint Peter”

10.caption: When in doubt, check the world: Shadows that may appear odd in a painting could turn out to occur in reality. Image credit: Roberto Casati, Paris, September 2018.

11.caption: Fig. 15 / Light from two openings on the left-hand wall creates double shadows, whose intersection is triangular. Robert Campin

15.caption: Fig. 24 / Shadow chaos. Items that are parallel should cast parallel shadows. Arrows of identical color indicate the direction of shadows from legs or other items that are reasonably parallel in the scene. Luca Signorelli

16.caption: Fig. 27 / An angel can, after all, obstruct light. Lorenzo Lotto

3711447088.resolved_title: Auction Houses and Galleries Are Working Together—Here’s Why
3711447088.excerpt: Purchasing art via auction is very different from buying art at a gallery. At auctions, prices are transparent, all are welcome to bid, and the highest bidder wins the artwork. At galleries, the process for acquiring a piece—and the price of the piece itself—can be much more opaque.

1.caption:
Longing and whimsy, innocence and experience, irreverence and wit, as well as a penchant for the purely zany, coexist in Banksy’s work. A girl releases a heart-shaped balloon, one in a series of similar motifs produced in locations worldwide.
                        Steve Cotton / Art of the State

Banksy melds street-fighting passion and pacifist ardor in his image of a protester whose Molotov cocktail morphs into a bouquet.

5.credit: Steve Cotton / Art of the State

In a piece of conceptual sculpture, an unsuspecting phone booth is felled by a vengeful pickax.

6.caption:
While skewering the art world’s pretensions, Banksy has maintained an activist’s belief in the power of images to effect change. At a show in Bristol in 2009, he hung a painting with a hefty price tag, then inserted a howl protest—“You have got to be kidding me”—into the work.
                        Banksy

Elsewhere, pure fantasy reigns: an origami crane fishes from a riverbank.

3803117410.resolved_title: Portrait of a killer: art class in one of Mexico’s most notorious prisons
3803117410.excerpt: After two decades working in some of Mexico’s toughest prisons, warden Ángeles Zavala thought she had seen it all. Then one morning in 2016, she arrived for work at Puente Grande prison to find a local artist waiting for her.

3806433379.resolved_title: What you learn about beauty and grief as a guard at the Metropolitan Museum of Art
3806433379.excerpt: After his brother’s death, Patrick Bringley took a job at the grandest place he could find. After Patrick Bringley lost his older brother in 2008, he decided to take the most straightforward job he could think of in the most beautiful place he knew.
